Light pathway list

Light pathway list

Promotes links to tertiary content within the context of the page.

    On this page
  • Visual design
  • Guidelines for use
  • Layouts

Visual design

Light pathway

The light pathway is an in-page link to another page on the site.

CSS styles

h3 {
    font-family: OpenSans-Semibold;
    font-size: 21px;
    color: #333333;
    letter-spacing: 0;
    line-height: 28px;
}
h3:hover {
    color: #254F90;
    text-decoration: underline;
}
Link description
p {
    font-family: OpenSans;
    font-size: 16px;
    color: #333333;
    letter-spacing: 0px;
    line-height: 28px;
}
Link icon
.icon {    
    color: #254F90;
    height: 16px;
    width: 16px;
}
Component container
.container {
    background: #ffffff;
    padding: 16px 24px 24px 0;
    border-top: 4px solid #B3C2D8;
}
.container:hover {
    background: #EFF4FB;
}

Mobile

Heading
h3 {    
    font-family: OpenSans-Semibold;
    font-size: 21px;
    color: #333333;
    letter-spacing: 0;
    line-height: 30px;
}

View design and assets in Adobe XD.

Guidelines for use

Purpose

Generally used as a lightweight option within index pages alongside hero, standard or featured pathways to build page hierarchy.

When to use this component.

Coming soon.

Layouts

Page width

Light pathway components should only be used in full width pages.

Equal width layout

Note: Components have a 32px horizontal gutter between them but zero padding between rows.

Desktop: Three equal width components in a row.

Tablet: Two equal width components in a row.

Mobile: One equal component in a row.
